contentrichtext.text: :''This article is about the movie '''Octobre'''; for information about the Gregorian month, see [[October]].'' {{Infobox Film | name = Octobre | image = | image_size = | caption = | director = [[Pierre Falardeau]] | producer = [[Marc Daigle]] | writer = [[Francis Simard]] (book)<br> [[Pierre Falardeau]] | narrator = | starring = [[Hugo Dubé]] <br>[[Luc Picard]]<br>[[Serge Houde]] | music = Richard Grégoire | cinematography = Alain Dostie | editing = Michel Arcand | distributor = | released = 30 September 1994 | runtime = 97 min | country = {{flagicon|Canada}} [[Canada]] | language = [[French language|French]] | budget = | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''Octobre''''' is a [[1994 in film|1994]] [[Quebec]] movie directed by filmmaker and noted [[Quebec sovereignty movement|separatist]] [[Pierre Falardeau]]. It tells a fictionalized version of the [[October Crisis]] from the point of view of the [[Chénier Cell]], the [[Front de libération du Québec|FLQ]] terrorist cell who in 1970 kidnapped and murdered Quebec minister and Deputy Premier [[Pierre Laporte]]. The movie was co-written with and based on a book by [[Francis Simard]], who was one of the members of the Chénier Cell, and co-produced by the [[National Film Board of Canada]]. ==See also== *[[Cinema of Quebec]] *[[October Crisis]] *[[Front de libération du Québec]] *[[History of Quebec]] ==External links== * {{imdb title | id=0110709 | title=Octobre}} * [http://www.onf.ca/trouverunfilm/fichefilm.php?id=31669&v=h&lg=fr&exp=${octobre} NFB Web page (in French)] <!-- Please do not remove the 3 primary film categories -Year, Country, Language --> <!-- end of primary film categories --> [[Category:1994 films]] [[Category:Canadian films]] [[Category:Quebec films]] [[Category:French-language films]] [[Category:Canadian drama films]] [[Category:Films based on actual events]] [[Category:National Film Board of Canada films]] [[Category:Films shot in Montreal]] [[Category:Films set in Montreal]] [[Category:October Crisis]] {{Quebec-hist-stub}} {{Canada-film-stub}}
